content.question: Which of the following best characterizes the National Origins Act of 1924 ?

choices.label: It allowed Chinese immigrants entry into the United States after 1930.
It allowed increased levels of immigration from southern and eastern Europe.
It established immigration quotas based on a percentage of each nationality residing in the United States in 1890.
It established procedures for the immigration of alien spouses of United States citizens after 1935.
It set restrictions on the importation of certain goods.

content.answer: It established immigration quotas based on a percentage of each nationality residing in the United States in 1890.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify a historical concept, development, or process.
